section.title: Network interfaces
section.para:
You can enter into network interfaces configuration at
Network Interfaces
at the left menu.
For each network interface we can choose a new name and its configuration. Available configurations are:

listitem.para:
It will assign permanently an IP adress to the network interface. Once you have choosen the configuration, you can set if this network interface is external
, its IP adress and its network mask.

When you select this option for configuration, the network interface will be configured dinamically if a DHCP Server exists on the network. The only configuration parameter is the ability to be an external interface.

section.title: Virtual interfaces
section.para: It's possible to create new virtual interfaces bound to any interface configured as static.
Once you have configured static interface, a form will be shown to add virtual interfaces, where you can assign their name, IP adress and network mask.

section.title: DNS Servers
section.para: You can set IP adresses for the DNS Server that you want to use to solve host names. You have to remember that, if your network interfaces are configured with DHCP, your network settings could be overwritten.

section.title: Routes
section.para:
You can access to Routes configuration through
Network Routes .

section.title: Default gateway
section.para: Default gateway will be, usually, your router IP adress.

section.title: Diagnostic tools
section.para: You can use this tools to check if your network settings are correct.

Selecting
Network Diagnostics
you could make a ping to a reachable host through your network interfaces, or you can resolve a domain name.
The output of this operations will be shown on this page, corresponding with the standard output of the GNU/Linux commands ping and dig.
